p: With the purpose of evaluating the anti-cancer capacity of compound 127, Wan et al. [ 49] verified through western blot assay based on Lu et al. [ 88] the regulatory roles of compound 127 in ROS/mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase (MEK)/extracellular signal-regulated kinase (ERK) signaling pathways and effects of these on the autophagy, migration, and invasion. N-acetyl- l-cysteine (NAC) was used as a ROS remover was able to suppress ROS production, and the role of compound 127 in MEK/ERK signaling. On the other hand, U0126 used as a MEK/ERK inhibitor did not inhibit ROS production, although a decrease in MEK/ERK activity was observed. Thus, it was possible to identify that compound 127 activated the MEK/ERK signaling, playing a crucial role.
